alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 19 at 12:32PM EDT until July 20 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Vermont, including the following county, Orleans. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Lake Memphremagog, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1226 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring and has flooded some roads with some homes currently unreachable. - Lake Mempremagog is a slow responding watershed and flooding will continue for an extended period of time. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake Mempremagog, Newport City, Coventry, Derby, Newport Town, Horseneck Island, Holbrook Bay, Derby Bay, Bell Island, South Bay In Orleans County, Black Island, Cove Island and North Derby. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
